main event: One sighting over Washington, D.C. on 15th October 1955 described a round, cloud-colored object moving at high speed with no sound, which was determined to be unidentified.
interesting points: The sighting in Washington, D.C. reported a round, cloud-colored object with no sound, moving at high speed.
A detailed account of a UFO sighting over Dayton, Ohio described a very bright, circular object hovering at low altitude and then accelerating rapidly and disappearing.
The witness in Dayton, Ohio reported that the object made no sound, had no exhaust fumes or flames visible, indicating unusual characteristics.
The witness in Dayton, Ohio was deemed reliable and had no apparent reason to fabricate the story, adding credibility to the report.
The conclusion for the Washington, D.C. sighting was that the object was unidentified due to insufficient data for evaluation.
sighted object: round, cloud-colored object moving at high speed
witnesses: reliable male witness in Dayton, Ohio
